John_Carter_Cash:
{{Short description|American singer, author, songwriter and producer (born 1970)}} {{Use mdy dates|date=August 2013}} {{Infobox musical artist | name = John Carter Cash | image = John Carter Cash sings.jpg | caption = Cash performing in 2015 | birth_name = | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1970|03|03}} | genre = [[Country music|Country]] | origin = | occupation = Singer-songwriter, musician, record producer, film producer | instrument = {{hlist|Vocals|guitar}} | years_active = 1985–present | spouse = {{unbulleted list| | {{marriage|[[Laura Weber White|Laura Weber]]|2000|2013 | end =div}} | {{marriage|[[Ana Cristina Cash]]|2016}} }} | label = {{flat list| * [[Bluebird Records|Vocalion]] * [[Decca Records|Decca]] * [[Victor Records|Victor]] * [[American Recordings (record label)|American]] * [[House of Cash]] }} | associated_acts = {{flat list| * [[Johnny Cash]] * [[Carter Family]] * [[June Carter Cash]] }} | background = solo_singer }} '''John Carter Cash''' (born March 3, 1970) is an American [[country music|country]] singer-songwriter, musician and author. He is the only child of [[Johnny Cash]] and his second wife [[June Carter Cash]]. He is the grandson of [[Maybelle Carter|Mother Maybelle Carter]].{{Cite web|url=https://www.countrythangdaily.com/john-carter-cash/|title=Get To Know The Man in Black's Multi-Talented Son, John Carter Cash|date=April 1, 2021}} ==Biography== [[File:Johnny Cash and Son 1975.jpg|right|thumb|upright|With his father, {{circa}} 1975]] John has four older half-sisters from his father's first marriage to [[Vivian Cash]] (née Liberto). They are [[Rosanne Cash|Rosanne]], Kathy, [[Cindy Cash|Cindy]], and Tara. He also has two older half-sisters from his mother's previous marriages, singers [[Carlene Carter]] and Rosie Nix. For several years after John's birth, his father altered the conclusion of "[[A Boy Named Sue]]" to mention the boy by name. In 1972 his parents recorded the duet "I Got a Boy (And His Name is John)" about their son. In 1975 a photograph of him with his father was featured on the sleeve of the album ''[[Look at Them Beans]]''.{{citation needed|date=April 2022}} Like many of his siblings, John Cash followed his parents into show business. He has worked as a singer-songwriter, musician, and producer. He was music producer on his mother's albums ''[[Press On (June Carter Cash album)|Press On]]'' and ''[[Wildwood Flower (album)|Wildwood Flower]]''; the latter won a [[Grammy Awards|Grammy Award]] for Best Traditional Folk album.{{Cite web|url=https://www.allmusic.com/album/wildwood-flower-mw0000042126/credits|title=Wildwood Flower - June Carter Cash | Credits | AllMusic|via=www.allmusic.com}} He was the associate producer of his father's ''[[American III: Solitary Man]]'' and ''[[American IV: The Man Comes Around]]''. In the early 1990s he toured with his father as a rhythm guitarist. He has also produced recordings for such artists as: [[Sheryl Crow]], [[Loretta Lynn]], [[Willie Nelson]], [[Elvis Costello]], [[Kris Kristofferson]], [[Emmylou Harris]], and [[Vince Gill]]. He owns and operates Cash Cabin Enterprises, LLC., a music production company in the Cash Cabin Studio.{{Cite web|url=https://www.pbs.org/kenburns/country-music/john-carter-cash-biography|title=John Carter Cash Biography|website=Country Music}}{{Cite web|url=https://www.allmusic.com/artist/john-carter-cash-mn0000811962/credits|title=John Carter Cash | Credits|website=AllMusic}} [[File:John Carter Cash and Ana Cristina Cash sing.jpg|thumb|John Carter Cash and [[Ana Cristina Cash]] sing]] ==Marriage and family== By 1999, John Carter Cash had met fiddler [[Laura Weber White|Laura Weber]] when she joined his parents' ''[[Press On (June Carter Cash album)|Press On]]'' tour to promote his mother’s album of the same name. John Carter Cash and Laura Weber were married in 2000.{{Cite web|url=https://www.junecartercash.com/timeline/|title=Timeline|website=June Carter Cash Official Site}} They had two children, Anna Maybelle Cash (nicknamed AnnaBelle) and Jack Ezra Cash.{{Cite web|url=https://www.mandolincafe.com/news/publish/mandolins_001243.shtml|title=10 Questions for Laura Weber Cash|website=Mandolin Cafe}}[https://sckool.org/the-story-of-the-oregon-old-time-fiddlers-association.html?page=11 The story of the Oregon Old-time Fiddlers Association][https://www.coloradofiddlers.org/wp-content/uploads/2013/12/Laura-Weber-Cash-Bio.pdf Colorado Old Time Fiddlers' Association, Laura Weber Cash]{{Cite web |title=It's a boy for the Cash family |url=https://www.countrystandardtime.com/news/newsitem.asp?xid=11880 |access-date=2022-03-13 |website=www.countrystandardtime.com}} They later divorced in 2013. He later married [[Ana Cristina Cash]], a singer, in 2016 in [[Charleston, South Carolina]]. They have two children, Grace June{{Cite web|url=https://theboot.com/john-carter-cash-ana-cristina-cash-baby-girl/ |website=theboot.com |title=John Carter + Ana Cristina Cash Welcome Baby Girl |author=Angela Stefano |date= September 18, 2017 |access-date=May 30, 2021}} and James Kristoffer. Cash also has one older son, Joseph John, from another previous marriage.{{Cite web |title=It's a boy for the Cash family |url=https://www.countrystandardtime.com/news/newsitem.asp?xid=11880 |access-date=2022-03-13 |website=www.countrystandardtime.com}}[https://theboot.com/john-carter-cash-ana-cristina-cash-baby-girl-2017/ John Carter Cash, Wife Ana Cristina Expecting a Baby Girl] TheBoot.Com by Angela Stefano. Published: April 14, 2017. Also executive producer |- |} == Books == Cash has written books about his parents: * ''Anchored in Love: an intimate portrait of June Carter Cash'', Thomas Nelson, 2007 * ''House of Cash: the legacies of my father Johnny Cash'', Insight Editions, 2011 * ''Cash and Carter family cookbook: recipes and recollections from Johnny and June's table'', Thomas Nelson, 2018 He also has written children's books: * ''Momma Loves Her Little Son'', Little Simon Inspirations, 2009 * ''Daddy Loves His Little Girl'', Little Simon Inspirations, 2010 * ''The Cat in the Rhinestone Suit'', Little Simon Inspirations, 2012 * ''Lupus Rex'', a novel, Ravenstone, 2013. ==See also== *[[House of Cash]] ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== *{{Cite web|url=http://www.imdb.com/name/nm0143601/|title=John Carter Cash|website=IMDb}} {{Johnny Cash}} {{June Carter Cash}} {{Carter Family}} {{Authority control}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Cash Carter, John}} [[Category:1970 births]] [[Category:21st-century American singer-songwriters]] [[Category:American country singer-songwriters]] [[Category:American male singer-songwriters]] [[Category:American people of English descent]] [[Category:American people of Scottish descent]] [[Category:Cash–Carter family]] [[Category:Grammy Award winners]] [[Category:Johnny Cash]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Record producers from Tennessee]] [[Category:The Great Eighties Eight members]] [[Category:The Tennessee Three members]]
